result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan A. MORALES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Hydrocodone), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Continue with current treatment program.  

No employment/volunteer work with individuals at risk over age 62.

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

supervisions.notes: under the Huber Law, concurent with Count 3 and 15 CF 753.
under the Huber Law, concurrent with count 2 and 15 CF 753.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan A. MORALES

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.    
Defendant is before the Court for sentencing, her probation having been revoked effective 06-29-18.   
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ten (10) months, under the Huber Law, on each count, concurrent and concurrent with 15 CF 753.   Defendant is given credit for 172 days already served.    Court orders costs converted to a civil judgment.   
Minutes.
Gerard Werner, through Public Defender.
Per Request of Public Defender Office
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 17, 2018 at 11:30 am.
Cover Letter.

Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.

At 1:12 p.m. $4,500.00 cash bail furnished.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.
Re:  Verna Hansen, on 01-12-16.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary, felony bail jumping and possession of schedule II narcotic (Hydrocodone).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-25-16 at 2:30 p.m., Br. 1.  Bail is set at $4,500.00 cash bail with the conditions defendant it to have no contact with Verna Hansen or her residence of 2114 Lexington Drive, Manitowoc and no contact with Lynn Seidl-Babcock or the premises of Homecare Health Services, defendant is not to possess any controlled substances not prescribed to her and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs except drugs that are prescribed to her.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
